com.evernote.android.job

Class JobConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.evernote.android.job.JobConfig

  • public final class JobConfig
extends Object
    A global configuration for the job library.

    See JobCat for settings to enable/disable logging.

    • Method Detail

      • isApiEnabled

        public static boolean isApiEnabled(@NonNull
                                   JobApi api)
        Returns:
        Whether the given API is enabled. By default all APIs are enabled, although the current device may not support it.

      • setApiEnabled

        public static void setApiEnabled(@NonNull
                                 JobApi api,
                                 boolean enabled)
        WARNING: Please use this method carefully. It's only meant to be used for testing purposes and could break how the library works.

        Programmatic switch to enable or disable the given API. This only has an impact for new scheduled jobs.
        Parameters:
        api - The API which should be enabled or disabled.
        enabled - Whether the API should be enabled or disabled.

      • forceApi

        public static void forceApi(@NonNull
                            JobApi api)
        WARNING: You shouldn't call this method. It only exists for testing and debugging purposes. The JobManager automatically decides which API suits best for a Job.
        Parameters:
        api - The JobApi which will be used for future scheduled JobRequests.

      • isAllowSmallerIntervalsForMarshmallow

        public static boolean isAllowSmallerIntervalsForMarshmallow()
        Checks whether a smaller interval and flex are allowed for periodic jobs. That's helpful for testing purposes.
        Returns:
        Whether a smaller interval and flex than the minimum values are allowed for periodic jobs are allowed. The default value is false.

      • setAllowSmallerIntervalsForMarshmallow

        public static void setAllowSmallerIntervalsForMarshmallow(boolean allowSmallerIntervals)
        Option to override the minimum period and minimum flex for periodic jobs. This is useful for testing purposes. This method only works for Android M and earlier. Later versions throw an exception.
        Parameters:
        allowSmallerIntervals - Whether a smaller interval and flex than the minimum values are allowed for periodic jobs are allowed. The default value is false.

      • setForceAllowApi14

        public static void setForceAllowApi14(boolean forceAllowApi14)
        On some devices for some reason all broadcast receiver and services are disabled. This library cannot work properly in this case. This switch allows to use the AlarmManager as fallback even in such a weird state.

        If the value is true, then this suppresses the JobManagerCreateException during the creation of the job manager.
        Parameters:
        forceAllowApi14 - Whether API 14 should be used as fallback in all scenarios. The default value is false.

      • isForceAllowApi14

        public static boolean isForceAllowApi14()
        Returns:
        Whether API 14 should be used as fallback in all scenarios. The default value is false.

      • addLogger

        public static boolean addLogger(@NonNull
                                JobLogger logger)
        Add a global logger for the job library, which will be notified about each log statement.
        Parameters:
        logger - Your desired logger.
        Returns:
        true if the logger was added. Returns false if the logger was already added.

      • removeLogger

        public static void removeLogger(@NonNull
                                JobLogger logger)
        Remove a global logger.
        Parameters:
        logger - Your desired logger.
        See Also:
        addLogger(JobLogger)

      • setLogcatEnabled

        public static void setLogcatEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Global switch to enable or disable printing log messages to Logcat.
        Parameters:
        enabled - Whether or not to print all log messages. The default value is true.

      • isLogcatEnabled

        public static boolean isLogcatEnabled()
        Returns:
        Whether logging is enabled for this library. The default value is true.

      • getJobReschedulePause

        public static long getJobReschedulePause()
        Returns:
        The pause of job reschedule service in milliseconds.

      • setJobReschedulePause

        public static void setJobReschedulePause(long pause,
                                         @NonNull
                                         TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Overrides the default job reschedule pause. The default value is 3 seconds.
        Parameters:
        pause - The new pause.
        timeUnit - The time unit of the pause argument.

      • isSkipJobReschedule

        static boolean isSkipJobReschedule()

      • setSkipJobReschedule

        static void setSkipJobReschedule(boolean skipJobReschedule)

      • getJobIdOffset

        public static int getJobIdOffset()
        Returns:
        The offset for the very first job ID. The default value is 0 and very first job ID will be 1.

      • setJobIdOffset

        public static void setJobIdOffset(int jobIdOffset)
        Adds an offset to the job IDs. Job IDs are generated and usually start with 1. This offset shifts the very first job ID.
        Parameters:
        jobIdOffset - The offset for the very first job ID.

      • isForceRtc

        public static boolean isForceRtc()
        Returns:
        Whether the alarm time should use System.currentTimeMillis() (wall clock time in UTC). The default value is false and will use the alarm time in SystemClock.elapsedRealtime() (time since boot, including sleep).

      • setForceRtc

        public static void setForceRtc(boolean forceRtc)
        Parameters:
        forceRtc - Force using the alarm time in System.currentTimeMillis() (wall clock time in UTC). The default value is false and will use the alarm time in SystemClock.elapsedRealtime() (time since boot, including sleep).

      • getClock

        public static Clock getClock()
        Returns:
        A helper providing the system time

      • setClock

        static void setClock(Clock clock)

      • getExecutorService

        public static ExecutorService getExecutorService()
        Returns:
        The executor service for all parallel execution.

      • setExecutorService

        public static void setExecutorService(@NonNull
                                      ExecutorService executorService)
        Overrides the executor service for all parallel execution. This could be helpful for Espresso tests.
        Parameters:
        executorService - The new executor service.

      • isCloseDatabase

        public static boolean isCloseDatabase()
        Returns:
        Whether the internal database is closed after each access. The default value is false.

      • setCloseDatabase

        public static void setCloseDatabase(boolean closeDatabase)
        Controls whether the internal database should be closed after each access to clean up resources. The default value is false.
        Parameters:
        closeDatabase - Whether to close the database after each access.

      • reset

        public static void reset()
        Resets all adjustments in the config.
